title: Temne (1904) Acts
description:
Temne (also Themne, Timne) is a language of the Mel branch of the Niger-Congo language family, spoken in Sierra Leone by about 2.5 million first-language speakers. it is spoken by 36% of Sierra Leone’s population. It also serves as a lingua franca for an additional 1,800,000 people. Themne speakers live mostly in the Northern Province and Western Area (Freetown. Temne people can be found in a number of other West African countries as well, including Guinea and The Gambia. Some Temnes have also migrated beyond West Africa seeking educational and professional opportunities, especially in Great Britain, the United States, and Egypt.
